correction.p: OCR generated transcript has not been corrected.

normalization.p: Only minor normalization where needed, if any, is indicated via markup.

punctuation.p: All punctuation marks in the source text have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.
Punctuation may be marked up with pc elements for clarification, but not exclusively.

quotation.p: All quotation marks have been retained, and are represented by appropriate Unicode code points.

hyphenation.p: Hyphenated words that appear at the end of a line have been retained. The hyphen, if present, is represented by the Unicode code point, and marked up with a pc element. The break="no" attribute on the lb element indicates that a single word is split across the lines.

interpretation.p: Dates, places, and names may be marked up, where useful.

GENERAL EXCHANGE INSURANCE CORPORATION
Standard
Automobile Policy
FORM
NEW YORK. NEW YORK
(HEREINAFTER CALLED THE COMPANY)
COMPANY
In consideration of the stipulations herein named and of the premiums hereinafter specifically mentioned, does insure
the dealer and the purchaser named below, and the General Motors Acceptance Corporation as their interests may appear,
and their legal representatives (hereinafter called the Assured) TO AN AMOUNT NOT EXCEEDING THE ACTUAL
CASH VALUE OF THE PROPERTY AT THE TIME ANY LOSS OR DAMAGE OCCURS, nor, in any event, the
Limits of Liability herein specified, against direct loss or damage from the perils specifically insured against herein and
designated by a premium, to the automobile herein described and the equipment usually attached thereto, while within the
territorial limits of the states comprising the United States, the District of Columbia, Alaska and the Dominion of Canada,
including while on coastwise steamer between ports within said limits. The term of this insurance commences at noon on the
effective date named herein and terminates at noon on the expiration date named herein.
Acknowledgment is hereby made of the notice of the existence of a lien on the herein described automobile, in favor of
said Dealer or General Motors Acceptance Corporation or their assignees.
The description of the automobile insured herein and the facts respecting its purchase are as follows:

iir, Elmer Harrison

Dear Sir: 50031 - P16
In acknowledging receipt of the final payment on your
account, for which we thank you, may we express our
appreciation for the opportunity we have had in serving
you. We are returning your contract to the dealer
from whom you made your purchase for delivery to you.
Over eleven million buyers have taken advantage of the
low cost General Motors Instalment Plan through dealers
in General Motors products. This plan includes terms
to fit the buyer's needs, valuable insurance protec
tion on cars and trucks, and a friendly, helpful
relationship.
To the prospective buyer of household equipment or of
personal and business transportation. General Motors
offers a wide range of products, whose quality has been
demonstrated by widespread public preference. Perhaps
at this time you are considering the purchase of one
of the products listed on the following page. If so,
the advantages of the General Motors Instalment Plan
are again available to you.
Should you desire to use G?JIAC as a reference, we will
be glad to answer any inquiries that may be received.
Yp^urs very t
Branch Manager.
FEDERAL SECURITY AGENCY
SOCIAL SECURITY BOARD
Bureau of Old-Age and 155 St. ,
Survivors Insurance ^^ev: York 17»
Area Office
CERTIFICATE OF AWARD
Field Office; Syracuse, N.Y.
l^re, Mary Ann Harrison,
Spring St.,
Hamilton, H.Y. Date: July 6, 19'i3
Claim Number: 07^05-7^92^
l^ear Mgdam: W, E, George H,, Harrison
This is to certify that you are entitled to Widow's Insurance Benefits,
payable monthly.
Your regular monthly benefit will be $ 13.35
You became entitled to benefits as of April 19^3
The first check includes benefits for April - Jtme I9U3 incltisive.
The first payment is in the amount of $ 33,06*
A check for this amount will be mailed within a fev; days.
•Oar records show that you were entitled to a benefit of yS.90 as wife of
George H, Harrison for March I9U3. Aleo that your husband was entitled
to a benefit of $17.80 for Mprch I9U3. However, we are deducting these
benefits from a lump-sum payment of $33.69 previously paid to your husband,
The balance, or $6,99, is deducted from your widow's benefits.
w 0. C. Pogge,
Director.
SEE THE REVERSE SIDE OF THIS CERTIFICATE FOR THE CONDITIONS UNDER WHICH
THESE BENEFITS ARE NOT PAYABLE, AND FOR OTHER IMPORTANT INFORMATION.
ALWAYS GIVE CLAIM NUMBER WHEN WRITING ABOUT YOUR CLAIM
Form OA-3
(7-42)
CONDITIONS UNDER WHICH THESE BENEFITS ARE NOT PAYABLE
This insurance benefit is not payable for any month in which you work for wages of
i _more than $14.99 in employment that is covered by the Social Security Act. This does
not mean that because you are entitled to monthly benefits you may not work, but simply
that for those months when you do work and earn more than $14.99 you will not be eligible
to receive a benefit payment.
Your entitlement to widow's insurance benefits ends with the month preceding the
month in which you marry again. '
Notice of the occurrence of either of the above events must be sent to the Social
&curity Board promptly, or certain penalties as provided by the Social Security Act may be
imposed. A postal card which may be used to notify the Social Security Board was given
to you when you filed your claim.
If you receive an insurance benefit check for any month in which either of the above
events occurs, you should return the check to the—
Treasury Department, Division of Disbursement
Located in the city shown on the face of your che(^
- CHANGE OF ADDRESS
Notify the Social Security Board and your local post office immediately of any change
of address so that your monthly insurance benefit checks will not be delayed. A postal card
which may be used to notify the Social Security Board was given to you when you filed your
claim.
RECONSIDERATION OR HEARING
A claimant for old-age 'and surviyors insurance benefits has a right to a reconsidera
tion or hearing if he is not satisfied with the decision on his claim. A reqpest for a recon-
_si(Jeration or hearing should-be made^roiaptly,-ii©t later than 6 months from the date of
this certificate, and should be made through the local field office of the Social Security Board.
CONSULT THE FIELD OFFICE SHOWN ON THE FACE OF THIS CJERTIFICATE. OR ANY
OTHER FIELD OFFICE OF THE SOCIAL SECURITY BOARD, IF YOU HAVE ANY QUESTIONS
CONCERNING YOUR CLAIM. HUJiiSilUNS
ALWAYS GIVE CLAIM NUMBER WHEN WRITING ABOUT YOUR CT.ATM
GUTHRIE CLINIC
ROBERT PACKER HOSPITAL
SAYRE, PENNSYLVANIA
SECTION OF INTERNAL MEDICINE
DR.S. D.CONKLIN
DR.W. D. LANGLEY
To Whom It May Concern:
September 12, 1954)-
Eq: Blmer Ijfeirrison
At autopsy a large ttinor was removed from the left lung.
The tumor had collapsed the major portion of the left lung and was markedly
adherent to the great vessels of the mediastinum, especially the aorta. Only
the tumor was removed and a pathological section was made. Tlie pathological
report showed this tumor to he a neurofihro sarcoma, a hi^ly malignant tumor.
KRC/M
Z.E. Crispell

marketable Title thereto together with an Abstract of Title.
The purchaser shall have possession of said Premises from and after
delivery of Deed,
